source: manchester united manager louis van gaal says he has been dreaming of beating rivals city in sunday 's derby at old trafford but will have to do so without robin van persie . van persie said he was fit to feature in the game against city on sunday after ankle trouble but van gaal has ruled him out . ' most of the players are fit but being fit for me is different , ' van gaal said . robin van persie will not return to the fray for manchester united against manchester city on sunday . louis van gaal explained at his press conference on friday that van persie is not yet fit enough to play . united players train in the sunshine ahead of their game against local rivals city on sunday . ' robin is not fit enough to play . ' with city rocking after defeat at crystal palace on monday , van gaal and his players have an opportunity to finish as high as second or third and avoid a champions league qualifying fixture later in the summer . the united boss wants his side to move towards that target by taking all three points against city . van gaal said : ' i dream of it . every player should dream of the victory . ' of course i want to win because it 's a big step up the table also . if we win then third place is available . van gaal watches on as he prepares his side for his first manchester derby at old trafford . manager van gaal ( left ) oversees the training while captain wayne rooney runs with the ball . goalkeeper david de gea ( left ) , winger angel di maria ( centre ) and radamel falcao were in training action . rooney leads the way in training as he runs through some cones in the sunshine on friday in manchester . ( left to right ) di maria , juan mata , falcao , marcos rojo and ander herrera prepare to take on city . ' a few months ago , nobody would have thought about that , apart from me . ' if we win then the position in the table is good as we would then almost certainly be qualified for the top four . and if we are third it 's better than the goal we set in pre-season . ' van gaal acknowledged that city will provide a stern challenge to his team and played down the idea he will be motivated by revenge , after losing the away fixture earlier in the campaign . ' we have lost 1-0 , that is my history , the last game , ' van gaal said . ' i say always in such games , always , you have to control your aggression . ' we did not do that at that time . so i hope we have learned from that moment . i can not say because we lost that game that we have to win this game . ' in my opinion , you can lose to man city two times . that is possible . ' the united boss also ruled out a potential return for luke shaw . like van persie , van gaal does not yet consider him fit enough to feature . ' i don’t think shaw is fit enough to play , ' van gaal said . ' but i can not say they are not fit , but in my opinion they are not fit to play . that is a different question . ' luke shaw is another player yet to be at the standard of match fitness required by van gaal . ( left to right ) rooney , ashley young , goalkeeper anders lindegaard and michael carrick have a breather . falcao ( left ) and antonio valencia ( second right ) look in high spirits as they prepare for the derby . herrera will be hoping to continue the fine form that has seen him become one of united 's key players recently . van gaal admitted he is looking forward to sampling the derby atmosphere at old trafford , as he takes on city with home advantage for the first time since arriving at the club . ' when i see the fans of man utd , they are supporting us in a marvellous way , i think , ' van gaal said . ' after matches , i give our fans a big compliment , not because i have to , because then i wouldn’t say it . i say it because i feel it . '
summary: anchester United manager Louis van Gaal will be without Robin van Persie for the derby against Manchester City at Old Trafford on Sunday due to ankle trouble. Van Gaal has ruled out Van Persie, stating he is not yet fit enough to play. The United boss wants his side to take all three points against City to finish as high as second or third in the table, potentially avoiding a Champions League qualifying fixture later in the summer. Van Gaal acknowledges that City will provide a stern challenge and plays down the idea of seeking revenge after losing the away fixture earlier in the campaign. Luke Shaw is also not yet fit enough to feature for United. Van Gaal is looking forward to experiencing the derby atmosphere at Old Trafford for the first time since arriving at the club.

source: manchester united manager louis van gaal says he has been dreaming of beating rivals city in sunday 's derby at old trafford but will have to do so without robin van persie . van persie said he was fit to feature in the game against city on sunday after ankle trouble but van gaal has ruled him out . ' most of the players are fit but being fit for me is different , ' van gaal said . robin van persie will not return to the fray for manchester united against manchester city on sunday . louis van gaal explained at his press conference on friday that van persie is not yet fit enough to play . united players train in the sunshine ahead of their game against local rivals city on sunday . ' robin is not fit enough to play . ' with city rocking after defeat at crystal palace on monday , van gaal and his players have an opportunity to finish as high as second or third and avoid a champions league qualifying fixture later in the summer . the united boss wants his side to move towards that target by taking all three points against city . van gaal said : ' i dream of it . every player should dream of the victory . ' of course i want to win because it 's a big step up the table also . if we win then third place is available . van gaal watches on as he prepares his side for his first manchester derby at old trafford . manager van gaal ( left ) oversees the training while captain wayne rooney runs with the ball . goalkeeper david de gea ( left ) , winger angel di maria ( centre ) and radamel falcao were in training action . rooney leads the way in training as he runs through some cones in the sunshine on friday in manchester . ( left to right ) di maria , juan mata , falcao , marcos rojo and ander herrera prepare to take on city . ' a few months ago , nobody would have thought about that , apart from me . ' if we win then the position in the table is good as we would then almost certainly be qualified for the top four . and if we are third it 's better than the goal we set in pre-season . ' van gaal acknowledged that city will provide a stern challenge to his team and played down the idea he will be motivated by revenge , after losing the away fixture earlier in the campaign . ' we have lost 1-0 , that is my history , the last game , ' van gaal said . ' i say always in such games , always , you have to control your aggression . ' we did not do that at that time . so i hope we have learned from that moment . i can not say because we lost that game that we have to win this game . ' in my opinion , you can lose to man city two times . that is possible . ' the united boss also ruled out a potential return for luke shaw . like van persie , van gaal does not yet consider him fit enough to feature . ' i don’t think shaw is fit enough to play , ' van gaal said . ' but i can not say they are not fit , but in my opinion they are not fit to play . that is a different question . ' luke shaw is another player yet to be at the standard of match fitness required by van gaal . ( left to right ) rooney , ashley young , goalkeeper anders lindegaard and michael carrick have a breather . falcao ( left ) and antonio valencia ( second right ) look in high spirits as they prepare for the derby . herrera will be hoping to continue the fine form that has seen him become one of united 's key players recently . van gaal admitted he is looking forward to sampling the derby atmosphere at old trafford , as he takes on city with home advantage for the first time since arriving at the club . ' when i see the fans of man utd , they are supporting us in a marvellous way , i think , ' van gaal said . ' after matches , i give our fans a big compliment , not because i have to , because then i wouldn’t say it . i say it because i feel it . '
summary: anchester United manager Louis van Gaal dreams of beating rivals Manchester City in Sunday's derby at Old Trafford but will have to do so without Robin van Persie, who is ruled out due to ankle trouble. Van Gaal emphasizes that being fit for the game is different and that most players are fit. The team aims to finish as high as second or third to avoid a Champions League qualifying fixture later in the summer. Van Gaal wants his side to take all three points against City, stating that a win would make third place available. The team, including captain Wayne Rooney and Radamel Falcao, is preparing for the derby. Van Gaal acknowledges City's challenge and hopes the team has learned from past mistakes. Luke Shaw is also ruled out due to fitness concerns. Van Gaal looks forward to the derby atmosphere at Old Trafford, with home advantage for the first time since joining the club.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage:

Louis van Gaal, Manchester United's manager, is preparing for the derby against Manchester City at Old Trafford. He has ruled out Robin van Persie and Luke Shaw from playing, stating they are not fit enough despite van Persie claiming he was ready. Van Gaal dreams of winning the derby, which could potentially secure United a third-place finish in the league. He emphasizes the importance of controlling aggression during the match, reflecting on their previous 1-0 loss to City. Van Gaal also expresses his appreciation for the United fans' support and looks forward to experiencing his first Manchester derby at Old Trafford as United's manager.

Despite the absence of key players Robin van Persie and Luke Shaw, who are not deemed match-fit, van Gaal believes his side can secure a victory and improve their league position. He praises the fans' support and is excited about the derby atmosphere. The manager aims to finish as high as second or third in the league and avoid a Champions League qualifying fixture.

summary: Manchester United's manager, Louis van Gaal, is preparing for the Manchester derby against Manchester City at Old Trafford. Van Gaal plans to field a full-strength team, except for Robin van Persie, who is ruled out due to ongoing ankle issues. Despite this setback, Van Gaal remains optimistic about securing a top-three finish in the league, which would secure a spot in the Champions League. He emphasizes the importance of winning against City, viewing it as a significant step towards achieving this goal. Van Gaal also mentions that Luke Shaw is not yet fit to play. The passage concludes with Van Gaal expressing his excitement about the derby atmosphere and the support from Manchester United's fans.

summary:
Here is a concise summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information described:

Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal is looking forward to beating local rivals Manchester City in Sunday's derby at Old Trafford, but will have to do so without Robin van Persie, who has been ruled out due to ankle trouble. Van Gaal wants his team to win to move towards a target of finishing second or third in the table, which would avoid a Champions League qualifying fixture later in the summer. The team has been training in the sunshine ahead of the game, with players such as Wayne Rooney, Angel Di Maria, and Radamel Falcao taking part. Van Gaal has also ruled out a potential return for Luke Shaw, citing that he is not yet fit enough to feature. The United boss is looking forward to the derby atmosphere at Old Trafford and is motivated by the opportunity to move up the table.

Here is a concise summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information described:

Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal is preparing his team to face Manchester City in the derby at Old Trafford on Sunday. However, Robin van Persie will not be available due to fitness concerns, despite the player claiming he is fit to play. Van Gaal also ruled out a potential return for Luke Shaw, citing similar fitness concerns. The United boss is eager to win the game, which could see his team finish as high as second or third in the league, and avoid a Champions League qualifying fixture. Van Gaal acknowledges that City will provide a tough challenge, but is looking forward to the derby atmosphere at Old Trafford and is focused on securing a victory.

' van gaal acknowledged that city will provide a stern challenge to his team and played down the idea he will be motivated by revenge , after losing the away fixture earlier in the campaign . ' we have lost 1-0 , that is my history , the last game , ' van gaal said . ' i say always in such games , always , you have to control your aggression . ' we did not do that at that time . so i hope we have learned from that moment . i can not say because we lost that game that we have to win this game . ' in my opinion , you can lose to man city two times . that is possible . ' the united boss also ruled out a potential return for luke shaw . like van persie , van gaal does not yet consider him fit enough to feature . ' i don’t think shaw is fit enough to play , ' van gaal said . ' but i can not say they are not fit , but in my opinion they are not fit to play . that is a different question . ' luke shaw is another player yet to be at the standard of match fitness required by van gaal . ( left to right ) rooney , ashley young , goalkeeper anders lindegaard and michael carrick have a breather . falcao ( left ) and antonio valencia ( second right ) look in high spirits as they prepare for the derby . herrera will be hoping to continue the fine form that has seen him become one of united 's key players recently . van gaal admitted he is looking forward to sampling the derby atmosphere at old trafford , as he takes on city with home advantage for the first time since arriving at the club . ' when i see the fans of man utd , they are supporting us in a marvellous way , i think , ' van gaal said . ' after matches , i give our fans a big compliment , not because i have to , because then i wouldn’t say it . i say it because i feel it . '
summary: Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal says he is looking forward to the derby against Manchester City at Old Trafford, but Robin van Persie will not be playing due to an ankle injury. Van Gaal says he wants his team to win the match to move up the table and avoid a Champions League qualifying fixture. He also says he is looking forward to the derby atmosphere at Old Trafford.

summary: Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal has expressed his desire to beat rivals Manchester City in the upcoming derby at Old Trafford. However, he will have to do so without the participation of Robin van Persie, who is not yet fit enough to play. Van Gaal emphasized the importance of winning the match to secure a higher position in the table and potentially avoid a Champions League qualifying fixture. He also acknowledged the challenge posed by City and downplayed the idea of seeking revenge for their previous loss. Additionally, van Gaal ruled out the possibility of Luke Shaw returning to the team, stating that he is not fit enough to play. The manager expressed his excitement about experiencing the derby atmosphere at Old Trafford and praised the support of Manchester United fans.

summary: Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal is eager to win the upcoming derby against Manchester City at Old Trafford but will be without Robin van Persie, who is not fit to play despite his own claims of readiness. Van Gaal emphasized the importance of fitness and ruled out both van Persie and Luke Shaw for the match. With City recently defeated by Crystal Palace, United has a chance to climb to third place and secure a better position for Champions League qualification. Van Gaal stressed the need for controlled aggression and learning from past mistakes, as United lost the previous fixture against City. He also expressed his appreciation for the support from United fans and looked forward to experiencing the derby atmosphere at Old Trafford.
